intro: Ribes rubrum var. sativum, commonly known as the red currant, is a deciduous shrub native to Europe and western Asia. It produces small, tart red berries that are rich in vitamin C and other antioxidants. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters and features alternate, simple, and serrated leaves. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained, fertile soil. The berries are often used in jams, jellies, and desserts due to their intense flavor.
